ItemTooltips.phase_boots: You want the extra damage as Windrunner. Phase Boots helps with that, plus the extra movement speed.
ItemTooltips.mekansm: Windranger can be played in a variety of ways. She can carry Mekansm if no one else is no one is aiming to rush it. Get it before Force Staff.
ItemTooltips.orchid: Orchid Malevolence gives Windranger the attack speed she needs and the crowd-control to make her useful in fights.
ItemTooltips.monkey_king_bar: Monkey King Bar works well with her ultimate and is just direct damage to really amplify her contribution to fights.
ItemTooltips.rod_of_atos: Rod of Atos is a situation item in which you want to combine it with your Force Staff to really add some crowd-control to ganks and team-fights on otherwise fast-paced hero.

AbilityTooltips.windrunner_shackleshot: Shackleshot is a tricky stun ability that extends its duration if you the stun near a tree or another unit (directly behind it, neither behind or in front).
AbilityTooltips.windrunner_powershot: Powershot is Windrunner's best ability due to its range, damage and ability to give sight in fogged areas. It's your best ability to not only deal damage from a great distance, but also to get those last hits in on fleeing opponents.
AbilityTooltips.windrunner_windrun: You only need one in Windrun for the escaping purpose. Later on, it will be used to deal damage without being affected by physical heroes.
AbilityTooltips.windrunner_focusfire: Focus Fire is generally used to push down towers or towers later in the game where you can deal much more damage. Max at 10-11 in exchange for more versatile abilities like Powershot and Shackleshot.
